data.headline: January CPI rose 0.2% m/m and 2.4% y/y, both below forecasts, reinforcing disinflation trends
bullets: Core CPI fell to four-year lows near 2.5%, easing Fed rate-hike fears and increasing rate-cut odds
Treasury yields declined as traders priced in a more dovish Fed outlook
S&P 500 gained 0.48%, Dow rose 0.30%, Nasdaq added 0.35%, and the Russell 2000 outperformed with a 1.6–1.7% jump
Rotation into small caps and value stocks accelerated, with notable strength in rate-sensitive sectors
Applied Materials surged ~13% on strong earnings, while Tri Pointe Homes jumped ~27%
Other notable gainers included Rivian, Roku, Moderna, Instacart, DraftKings, and Coinbase
Tariff-exposed metals and steel stocks lagged the broader market
Traders remain cautious ahead of next week’s jobs data and monitor lingering tech sector jitters
